textos_fuente.text: Glamping in Pensacola, FL | Vacay Village of Pensacola, LLC 850-463-4456 Get Directions Book Now Home Accommodations RV’s for Rent Glampers for Rent RV Pads Cabins Amenities Puppy Parties Rates & Availability About Pensacola Resources Contact Site Map Select Page 850-463-4456 Get Directions Book Now Discover Endless Fun & Endless Possibilities Our Rates & Availability Amenities Family-Fun Glamping in the Pensacola, FL Area From a spectacular waterfall and cave grotto next to our sparkling pool and hot tub, to a fully renovated stone clubhouse equipped with a media room, fitness room, and gathering spaces for meals and games, there’s no shortage of entertainment here at Vacay Village of Pensacola. We even have indoor games for all ages, ensuring fun never stops. And for those traveling with furry friends, we love welcoming your pets and even have a dedicated dog-wash station. Call Today! Book Your Stay! When You Stay With Us, You’ll Experience: Gated & Fully Enclosed Camping Village We prioritize your safety and security by providing a gated and fully-enclosed camping environment. Bathroom & Showers Clean and well-maintained bathrooms and showers are available for your convenience. Fitness Room Stay active and fit in our fitness room. Clubhouse & Pavilion Our clubhouse and pavilion are full of games and provide a space for community gatherings and events. We Welcome Your Furry Friends! All dogs must be on-leash at all times. However, we offer a special off-leash opportunity for those dogs that successfully complete the AKC Canine Good Citizen program so they can participate in our fun Puppy Parties during designated hours daily. Just ask us for more details. BBQ Hut Our BBQ hut is perfect for grilling up a delicious meal with family and friends. Onsite Management Team Our friendly and helpful onsite management team is available to assist you throughout your stay.  Daily, Weekly, & Monthly Rates Choose from flexible stay options with competitive rates ranging from $60 to $85 per night, with great weekly/monthly discounts. Game Room Have a friendly competition with fellow campers in our game room. Sparkling Pool with Spectacular Waterfall Cave Grotto Take a dip in our beautiful pool featuring a breathtaking waterfall cave grotto. Pizza Parties Join us for pizza parties, where you can enjoy delicious pizza and socialize with other campers. Full-Service Hookups Providing Power, Water & Septic All our RV pads come with full-service hookups to ensure your comfort during your stay. Dry Heat Sauna Relax and rejuvenate your body and mind in our dry heat sauna. Pizza Tree Oven Get a taste of freshly baked pizza from our unique pizza tree oven. Inground Hot Tub Soak away your worries in our inground hot tub. Playground Kids can have a blast at our playground, complete with games and water balloon battle stations. Multiple Fire Pits Enjoy evenings by the fire with multiple fire pits available throughout the park. Our Special Puppy Parties Special Puppy Parties are at designated times for your furry friend’s vacation too! Imagine giving your dog extra freedom to romp and play to their heart’s content off-leash. That’s exactly what our Puppy Parties offer. With a dedicated local trainer group visiting monthly, we focus on creating fun, safe, and engaging experiences for our long-term guests and their canine companions. If your pup is evaluated and passes, they’ll earn the delightful privilege of being off-leash in the main area during designated puppy party times, mingling and playing in an environment designed with their joy in mind. We’re eager to make this a standout experience for dog owners, with the promise of not just a stay but an unforgettable memory for you AND your pet. Dog friendly RV park at Vacay Village of Pensacola Dogs at Vacay Village of Pensacola Dog playing at Vacay Village of Pensacola Dogs outside at Vacay Village of Pensacola Vacay Village of Pensacola dogs Start your adventure today! Contact us at 850-463-4456 . Darien Schaefer President/​CEO Hometown: Milwaukee, Wisconsin Born in Milwaukee, WI and growing up in the resort community of Wisconsin Dells, Darien has been involved in the hospitality and tourism industry for over 40 years. Send An Email Read Bio Hometown: Milwaukee, Wisconsin Born in Milwaukee, WI and growing up in the resort community of Wisconsin Dells, Darien has been involved in the hospitality and tourism industry for over 40 years. A graduate from the University of Wisconsin-Stout with a degree in Hotel/Restaurant Management, Darien has worked for Holiday Inn Corporation, Marriott Hotels, and Tharaldson Lodging. It was with Tharaldson Lodging, as an Area Director responsible for 13 hotels in 8 different markets, that Darien began working closely with destination marketing organizations. Darien eventually left Tharaldson Lodging to become the Executive Director for the Janesville Area Convention & Visitors Bureau in 1998. In April of 2000, Darien joined the Wausau/Central Wisconsin Convention & Visitors Bureau. During his 13 years as the Executive Director, Marathon County rose from 17th to 9th out of 72 counties in Wisconsin for Economic Impact from traveler spending. Darien expanded the role of the CVB by creating a Sports Authority function that was responsible for developing new sporting events. Darien joined the Lake Geneva Chamber of Commerce and Convention & Visitors Bureau in November 2013. Under Darien’s leadership, the two organizations were merged into Visit Lake Geneva in 2016. Darien joined Visit Big Bear in 2017 as President & CEO to promote the resort community of Big Bear Lake, CA. In addition to growing tourism receipts by 83% in three years, Darien directed the purchase and renovation of a 5,000 sq. ft. building for a new Visitor Center and offices. Darien and his wife, Karen, moved to Pensacola in April of 2020 when he accepted the position of President & CEO for Visit Pensacola. Nicole Stacey Vice President of Destination Development Hometown: Fort Walton Beach, Florida Trendsetter. Coffee addict. Travel enthusiast Born and raised on the beaches of Northwest Florida, Nicole has an innate love for the Sunshine State, its pristine beaches, and the thrill of travel. Cultivating over 15 years of marketing and communications expertise, Stacey has over 20 years in the tourism and hospitality industry..... Send An Email Read Bio Born and raised on the beaches of Northwest Florida, Nicole has an innate love for the Sunshine State, its pristine beaches, and the thrill of travel. Cultivating over 15 years of marketing and communications expertise, Stacey has over 20 years in the tourism and hospitality industry. As Visit Pensacola's Vice President of Destination Development, Stacey leads the marketing and sales departments. She is responsible for identifying market opportunities, developing short- and long-term marketing and sales plans and strategies, directing all communications and public relations functions, and ensuring community-wide destination development investments increase and travel-related strategies are connected and aligned. Throughout her career, she has spearheaded numerous successful initiatives, marking significant achievements in the industry. Notable highlights include transforming Visit Pensacola's public relations efforts with out-of-market activations at prestigious events like the Country Music Awards in Nashville, Chicago Air and Water Show, several in-market television productions, and media-related opportunities in New York, Canada, and London, UK. Stacey has played a pivotal role in several multi-rebranding campaigns, including the development of Visit Pensacola's latest brand, "The Way to Beach." Additionally, she has been an integral part of the evolved Tourism Works for Pensacola campaign—an initiative to communicate tourism's invaluable impact in Escambia County. Actively engaging with professional and travel industry associations and dedicated to the Pensacola community, Stacey serves as a Board Member for Destinations Florida and contributes to the Destinations International PR Task Force. Additionally, she is a part of the NWFL Beaches Coalition Brand Team. She has assumed several leadership roles over her tenure, such as Chairing the 2023 Leadership Pensacola Class, being Past President of the University of West Florida Alumni Association, Fiesta Pensacola Board of Governors, Florida Public Relations Assoc past president and state board member, and the Foo Foo Festival Curator to name a few. Recognized as a rising star by InWeekly in 2013 and honored with the 2022 Florida Public Relations Association Communicator of the Year award. Stacey was recently named the 2023 Emerging Leader for the Greater Pensacola Chamber PACE Awards. She takes pride in representing her community worldwide and showcasing Pensacola as a premier travel destination. The proud graduate of her master's degree in strategic communications and leadership and a B.A. in public relations and marketing from the University of West Florida – Go Argos! In her spare time, Nicole finds joy in her role as "Auntie Coco," cherishing moments spent with family and friends, indulging in her community like a local should and booking her next plane ticket to fulfill her love and passion for travel and experiencing new places and cultures around the world. Wandy Samuel Director of Finance and Administration Hometown: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia Numbers guy. Super dad. Wandy entered the tourism industry in 2013 as a staff accountant for Premier Island Management Group... Send An Email Read Bio Wandy entered the tourism industry in 2013 as a staff accountant for Premier Island Management Group before joining the Visit Pensacola team in 2016. Previously, he served as the operations manager for Dollar Rent a Car of which he was responsible for effective and successful management of labor, productivity, quality control, safety measures and standard business operating procedures. He holds a degree in accounting from Pensacola Christian College.Outside of work, he enjoys spending time with his daughter. The two enjoy riding bikes, going shopping and Skyzone. He is an active member of Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida. Kaya Man Director of Sales & Services Hometown: Kailua-Kona, Hawaii Fishin’ chick. Chef. Beach bum Kaya Man joined Visit Pensacola in 2018 as the Partner Relations Manager... Send An Email Read Bio Kaya Man joined Visit Pensacola in 2018 as the Partner Relations Manager. She was responsible for partnership development and maintenance for the organization. In 2021 promoted to Destination Sales Manager, serving as the sales representative to the group and leisure market to generate a positive economic impact for Escambia County. In 2023 promoted to Director of Sales and Service, overseeing all sales efforts in group, trade and leisure markets, partner relations and the visitor centers. She has also taken on the role as the Northwest Florida Beaches Sales Representative to the Council. Kaya brings over 20 years of hospitality experience to the Visit Pensacola team. Man spent the last eight years prior to joining the team, serving, managing, and the head trainer at The Grand Marlin on Pensacola Beach. Previously, she owned an event planning company and Elephant Seasoning, a catering and seasoning business started by her father. She holds a bachelor’s degree in restaurant and hospitality management from the Pensacola Junior College and University of West Florida. Man is actively involved in the community, serving as UWF Women in Leadership Conference hospitality co-chair, Sun Belt Conference Team host committee, Sea Grant Advisory Team, donating time to the Children’s hospital, served as the Greater Pensacola Tennis Ladies League captain for 8 years, and a part owner/ operations manager to Tighten up Tennis. Outside of the office, she enjoys cooking, playing tennis, fishing, traveling, and spending time at the beach with her family. Ashley Hendrickson Administration Assistant Hometown: Pace, FL Book connoisseur. Athletics enthusiast. Bonding aficionado Ashley joined Visit Pensacola in 2023 as the Administration Assistant... Send An Email Read Bio Ashley joined Visit Pensacola in 2023 as the Administration Assistant. She is responsible for coordinating calendars between Darien, Staff and the Board, various office projects, and all things related to board meetings. Bottomline, Ashley will ensure the office runs smoothly and cohesively. She has spent the last seven years in New York City, most recently as the Executive Assistant to the owners of Team Epiphany, a marketing and creative agency. Her strengths include project support, process improvement, relationship development, and strategic communication. A Pensacola native, Ashley is a graduate of The University of West Florida with a bachelor's degree in Organizational Communication and a minor in Hospitality. While she is not in the office, she finds joy in various hobbies such as reading, attending theatre performances, engaging in sports, and relishing the great outdoors. Lana Malaise Staff Accountant Hometown: Pensacola, FL Devoted and passionate Mom. Numbers gal. Concert lover. Lana Malaise joined Visit Pensacola in April of 2024 as the Staff Accountant. She is responsible for assisting the Director of Finance in the processing of all things accounting related to Visit Pensacola. Send An Email Read Bio Prior to joining our team, Lana worked in the private sector as a Bookkeeper and Accounting Manager in various businesses in various locations to include Kentucky, Illinois and Florida. Lana originally moved to Pensacola in 1978 when her family moved here as a duty station of her father’s at USN Saufley Field Base, Pensacola. Upon graduating from UWF in 1988 as one of the school’s first class of freshman in 1983, she began her career in accounting at various local CPA firms. She left the area in 1993 to move to central Kentucky and finally returned ‘home’ to Pensacola/Pace area in 2016 after expanding her family with four beautiful daughters. Lana considers her greatest accomplishment to being a Mom. In her spare time, she enjoys playing tennis, playing cards with her family, and enjoying listening to live music along the Gulf Coast as much as she has time to do. Marketing and Communications Shawn Brown Digital Marketing Manager Hometown: Gulf Breeze, Florida IT Guy. Outdoor Aficionado. Family Guy. As the digital marketing manager, Shawn Brown joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2013... Send An Email Read Bio Shawn Brown joined the Visit Pensacola team as the digital marketing manager in 2013. He is responsible for managing the website, assisting partners with listings and supporting internal team members. He is experienced in search engine optimization, creative design and data analysis. Before Visit Pensacola, Brown served as a webmaster for Cox Communications for 13 years. There, he developed applications for internal communications and focused on web design. After college, he was self-taught in web design, coding, and information technology. Shawn earned a bachelor’s in biblical studies from Calvary Chapel Bible College. A true outdoorsman, Shawn and his wife Lindy own Outdoor Gulf Coast, an adventure equipment rental company. In his spare time, he enjoys windsurfing, paddling, hiking and more. The two have two children, Sarah and Sam. Lindsey Steck Marketing & Communications Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Experience chaser. Content curator. NFL buff Lindsey Steck joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2017 and is responsible for copywriting, writing for press, public relations... Send An Email Read Bio Lindsey Steck joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2017 and is responsible for copywriting, writing for press, public relations, integrated marketing, content curation and social media management. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Steck served as a corporate communications assistant for the Kansas City Chiefs where she served as a public relations contact for community outreach events. She was responsible for writing for press and publication, press conference facilitation, public relations, football communications support, assisting club executives and game day support. Throughout her time in college, she served in athletic communications as the public relations contact for men and women’s cross country and additionally assisted with 13 other sports. Steck began her journey in the tourism industry working for Florida House on Capitol Hill, the country’s only state embassy in Washington, D.C. There, she supported events, assisted administration and welcomed guests from across the globe. She holds a bachelor’s degree in communications with an emphasis in public relations from the University of West Florida. Outside of the office, Steck is actively involved in the community. She currently volunteers with Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida, Junior League of Pensacola and serves on the Board of Directors for the Florida Public Relations Association. In her free time, you can find her scouring farmer’s markets, watching NFL football and working on her East Hill cottage. Elliott Cooper Digital and Creative Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Gamer. Drone Flier. Digital Guy. Elliott Cooper joined Visit Pensacola in 2021 as the Digital & Creative Manager and is responsible for inhouse graphic and video creation... Send An Email Read Bio Elliott Cooper joined Visit Pensacola in 2021 as the Digital & Creative Manager and is responsible for inhouse graphic and video creation. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Elliott worked as a Digital Marketing Coordinator for Innisfree Hotels and Keep Pensacola Beautiful. Raised in Gulf Breeze, Elliott is a true local and spent most of his time growing up on Pensacola Beach. Elliott earned a bachelor's degree in communications from the University of West Florida. Elliott enjoys technology and loves tinkering with electronics and computers in his free time. He has two cats and two dogs and he loves taking the dogs on long walks on the nature trails around UWF. Blake Howerton Social Media & Content Associate Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Pensa-local. Creative being. Old soul. Blake Howerton joined Visit Pensacola in 2022 as the social media and content associate and is responsible for planning... Send An Email Read Bio Blake Howerton joined Visit Pensacola in 2022 as the social media and content associate and is responsible for planning, creating, and implementing social media content across eight platforms. Blake is a Pensacola native. After receiving a bachelor’s degree in communications with a focus in advertising from the University of North Florida in Jacksonville in 2018, Blake moved back home to begin his marketing career. Before joining the Visit Pensacola team, he served as the communications coordinator at Studer Family Entertainment & Retail for 3 years, and as the marketing and communications coordinator at Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida for over a year. Blake has a passion for sharing Pensacola’s story with others. Off the clock, Blake enjoys photography, cooking, watching the sunset on the beach with his friends, and dining at Pensacola’s many restaurants. He is actively involved with Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida serving on the Big Gala Committee. Hannah Pinson Website Associate Hometown: Navarre, Florida Sunset Lover. Ocean Enthusiast. Cat Mom. Hannah Pinson joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2023 as the Website Associate. She is responsible for creating and maintaining website content... Send An Email Read Bio Hannah Pinson joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2023 as the Website Associate. She is responsible for creating and maintaining website content, writing email newsletters, creating/editing blog posts, and more. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Pinson worked as an IT recruiter. She earned a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and a minor in Marketing Applications from the University of West Florida. She has experience in software development, digital marketing, public relations, and content creation. Outside of work, she enjoys creating videos and taking photos. She also loves to shop, go to Disney World, hang out with family, and play with her two cats. A proud UWF Alum, Hannah serves on the UWF IT Alumni Advisory Board. Growing up in the Florida panhandle, she has a huge appreciation for the beach and will never pass up an opportunity to catch a good sunset or go for a swim in the Gulf. Sales & Services Melissa Bailey Partner Relations Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Foodie. Optimist. Baseball Mom. Melissa Bailey joins the Visit Pensacola team with over 20 years of industry experience.... Send An Email Read Bio Melissa Bailey joins the Visit Pensacola team with over 20 years of industry experience. For the past 17 years, she has served Great Southern Restaurants as the director of catering and private events. With experience in both the front and back of house operations, she thrives in making connections with community partners and stakeholders. A native of Pensacola — and planning to stay that way by continuing to build roots with friends, family, and loyal customers, she is the perfect person to trust with your business needs. Tia Robbins Destination Sales Manager Hometown: Omaha, Nebraska Visionary. Connector. Boy Mom Tia Robbins joined the Visit Pensacola team as the Destination Sales Manager in February 2023.... Send An Email Read Bio Tia Robbins joined the Visit Pensacola team as the Destination Sales Manager in February 2023. In her role, she is responsible for facilitating leads and inquiries for group sales, attending trade shows, developing relationships with clients promoting Escambia County, and more. Prior to joining Visit Pensacola, Tia began her career in public relations and marketing in the music and entertainment industry in New York City. After relocating to the Pensacola area in 2012 she became deeply committed to, and passionate about serving the Pensacola community. In 2014, Robbins and her husband co-founded Mr. Robbins’ Neighborhood, a 501(c) 3 non-profit organization that serves underserved student athletes in Escambia and Santa Rosa Counties in Florida, by positioning, preparing and developing program participants for success beyond high school sports. In addition to working in the non-profit sector, Tia found a passion in entrepreneurship and supporting small businesses and in 2020 founded, Taste of Pensacola, LLC., a unique online gifting service that partners with local area makers and artisans to feature in a selection of curated and themed gift boxes. In her free time, Robbins enjoys traveling, being a sports mom, and making memories with her husband, Fred and two sons, Tre’ and Troi. Jennifer’s role is directly involved with destination sales, partner relations, organizing community tourism events, and more. Prior to joining Visit Pensacola, Jennifer served as the Executive Director of the Pensacola Mardi Gras Foundation, where she created impactful community experiences through PMG events. Then we’ve got answers for you! Please take a moment to browse these questions and answers to help make the most of your vacations with us. General Information Exchange ID Vacation Village Travel General Information + What is the Concierge Services Department? + The Owner’s Concierge Services Department is here to help you make new memories through travel. We accomplish this by educating owners on how to use their vacation ownership to the fullest. Concierge works hand in hand with the resorts, exchange companies, management companies, and our Mortgage Departments. Our goal is to provide reservations assistance and get your questions answered in one interaction. After all, our motto is One Call Answers All! What resorts are in the Vacation Village Resorts family? + You can see all of our resorts and affiliates by clicking on this link: www.vacationvillageresorts.com/resorts.html What information can I get from the Vacation Village Resorts website? + Visit www.vacationvillageresorts.com/resorts.html for information on our family of resorts, property amenities, internal external program information, important phone numbers, Affinity Rewards Program, the latest copy of our Happenings newsletter, and more. How do I know if an offer for my property is legitimate? + We want you to be aware of a growing number of timeshare exit companies that are inundating owners with direct mailings, telemarketing, and seminar invitations. They claim they can release them from their timeshare obligations, resell or rent their property for an up-front fee. Here are a few helpful tips and red flags for identifying and combatting timeshare exit, rental and resale scams: • Upfront Fees – beware of requests for upfront fees such as administrative fees, advertising fees, closing fees, and service or tax requirement fees. • Protect your information – another technique is to solicit owners on social media and ask for them to message or email their contact and ownership information. • Unsolicited Contact – beware of unsolicited calls, emails or correspondence from someone offering to sell, dispose of or rent your timeshare for any up-front fee. • Interested Buyer – beware of calls or emails claiming to have an interested buyer or renter for your timeshare. • Offers to transfer paid-off ownership – be wary of any calls or mailings that offer to transfer paid-off ownership to another party. • Too good to be true – beware of any offer that sounds too good to be true, these offers are usually a scam. • Read the warnings – don’t be tricked by a fancy address or professional-looking website. • Don’t be a victim – when in doubt, we encourage you to contact your resort, Association or management company or the Concierge Department at 1-888-629-9593 to confirm the authenticity of any proposal or offer being made to you. How do I leave a review for my Concierge Specialist? + Concierge relies on feedback provided by our owners to help maintain exceptional customer service on every call. We encourage owners to submit a Google review to Vacation Village Resorts (Corporate Office) about their personal experiences and include the name of the Concierge Specialist that assisted them. https://tinyurl.com/reviewvacationvillage Exchange ID + What is my exchange ID? + Your exchange ID is a unique number assigned by the exchange company that allows you to access their website and apps. Book Now Overview of Vacay Village of Pensacola Come to the Vacay Village of Pensacola and enjoy the magical, family-fun atmosphere! Vacay Village is designed for family fun, and we LOVE your furry family members, so bring them along!  They’ll love it too!  We even have a dog-wash station just for them so they don’t dirty up your RV after a day of fun in the sun. Our fully enclosed, lushly landscaped, and gated 15-acre community is in the western panhandle of Florida, within 20 miles of Pensacola Beach, and only 12 miles from the Pensacola International Airport.  Once you enter the gate as our guest, you will feel as if you’re way off the beaten path, surrounded by trees and the quiet of a peaceful getaway, yet with all the amenities of a comfortable resort.  Locally owned and operated, Vacay Village of Pensacola has become the new RV hotspot for weekend getaways and hardcore RV enthusiasts.  Featured in Pensacola News Journal, this is a little slice of paradise ready to welcome you and the whole family! The Pensacola area is full of LOTS to do and see.  Having been colonized by five separate nations, the city is infused with incredible historical forts, museums, and several lighthouses that capture the imagination.  With the home of The Blue Angel Flight Team nearby, practice sessions on Tuesdays and Wednesdays offer free admission to a spectacular show you don’t want to miss! Love the outdoors?  Pensacola doesn’t disappoint!  We have several nearby attractions for any enthusiast including the Santa Rosa Sports Complex, golf courses, several public fishing piers, boat ramps with fishing charter services, breathtaking hiking trails, and bird watching in the Blackwater River State Forest, the Gulf Islands National Seashore, and the Conecuh National Forest, not to mention the many gorgeous white, sugar-sand beaches to choose from!  All within a 20-40 minute drive, don’t miss out on all the incredible fun Pensacola has to offer! This was the 9th place we called and Judy answered the phone. She said YES there is space for us.  She gave us great information over the phone with the gate code and directions to our spot. RVs for Rent Our fleet features a wide selection of meticulously maintained RVs that cater to every traveler’s needs. Each rental comes fully equipped with all the amenities you need for a comfortable and hassle-free adventure. Vintage Beachcomber Camper Step back in time and experience the whimsical charm of our adorable 24′ vintage beachcomber glamper. This fully renovated gem features all-new “vintage” appliances and a cozy atmosphere that will transport you to a bygone era. All your comfort needs will be met with a fully equipped kitchen, including an electric cooktop and a full bathroom. And when you’re not lounging inside, you can enjoy the park’s incredible amenities, from the sparkling pool and hot tub to the fire pits and clubhouse filled with games. All three ratings categories are measured on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best. Less than 1 percent of parks or campgrounds receive the coveted 10 | 10 | 10 rating, which indicates superior facilities that are well maintained, clean, well-appointed restrooms and a highly appealing appearance. Campgrounds are inspected annually by dedicated RVers like you. Completeness of facilities 10 10 10 The first campground rating evaluates completeness and quality of facilities. In this category we rate interior roads, sites, registration area, hookups, recreation, swimming, security, laundry, store and building maintenance. Cleanliness of restrooms and showers 10 10 10 The second rating category concerns the cleanliness and physical characteristics of toilets, walls, showers, sinks/counters/mirrors and floor. If a park achieves a full point in each of the above, it receives a star ( ), indicating exceptionally clean restrooms. Also rated are physical characteristics of restrooms, including interior construction, adequate supplies/odor free, adequate number of facilities, exterior appearance and location in relation to park spaces, and interior appearance. Visual appeal and environmental quality 10 10 10 This category addresses the park's setting and site layout, function and identification of signage, overall exterior building maintenance, noise, trash disposal, litter and debris around the grounds and sites, and appearance of grounds, sites and entrance area.
